meanings.definition: Causing trouble or difficulty; not convenient.
meanings.sent1: It was very inconvenient to forget my umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent2: Carrying heavy bags while walking the dog is quite inconvenient.
meanings.sent3: It was rather inconvenient to realize I left my phone at home when I needed it the most.
meanings.sent4: The broken elevator made it inconvenient for the elderly residents to reach their apartments.
meanings.sent5: The traffic jam was so inconvenient that I missed my doctor's appointment.

meanings.definition: Not suited to one's comfort, purpose, or needs.
meanings.sent1: Wearing tight shoes is very inconvenient for long walks.
meanings.sent2: The small desk was inconvenient for spreading out all my papers.
meanings.sent3: It was quite inconvenient to have a sudden power outage during the movie night.
meanings.sent4: The lack of air conditioning made the room very inconvenient during the heatwave.
meanings.sent5: The broken handle on the suitcase was inconvenient for carrying it through the airport.
